page.title: 18PEATLING CHURCH
page.content:
ALL SAINTS CHURCH IN PEATLING MAGNA IS A NORMAN EARLY ENGLISH STRUCTURE AND IT WAS BUILT IN THE THIRTEENTH CENTURY.
IT HAD A TOWER, SPIRE AND FOUR BELLS IT NOW HAS FIVE BELLS AS ONE MORE WAS ADDED IN 1928. THE CHURCH HASN'T A AISLE, IT HAS NEVER HAD ONE. IN 1906 THE CHURCH WAS REPAIRED.
FOUR OF THE WINDOWS IN THE CHURCH WERE PUT IN AT THE TIME OF KING STEPHEN. THE CHURCH HAS A REGISTER WHICH DATES BACK TO 1565. IT HAS BEEN RUN BY MANY VICARS STARTING WITH, REV. W S BLUKE 1886-1898, REV. JOHN THOMAS LANGDALE 1898-1928 & REV. INGRAM 1928-1941.
